syllabus:
**Course Description**

This course is structured to provide you some basic constructs and theories in assessing English as a foreign language (EFL). The class will first learn to differentiate among evaluation, assessment, and testing. Then different purposes, and different types, of language assessment will discussed. A lot of time will be devoted to the techniques and principles in constructing test items for English vocabulary, grammar, listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Hands-on activity will be provided in and outside the class. Authentic test papers, including large-scale renowned tests, school monthly tests, and teacher-made tests, will be used as the sample for discussion in evaluating the quality of individual test items and the test papers. Students may choose to take a mid-term exam, or to write a term paper instead. At the end course, students need to work in groups of four producing a set of test papers on reading, listening, speaking, and writing. This group projects need to be presented orally in class for feedback, and submitted in written afterwards.

**Course Objectives**

At the end of this course, students will be able to

1.  understand basic constructs and principles in foreign language testing and assessment
2.  diagnose the problems in EFL test items on vocabulary, grammar, listening, speaking, reading, and writing;
3.  evaluate the quality of test papers and assessment tasks
4.  construct valid, practical and reliable EFL tests and develop assessment tasks for the use in high schools English class;
